key_points: Social media users migrated to other platforms during Facebook's 6-hour outage.
Snapchat Android users spent 23% more time on the app compared to the previous week.
Telegram gained 70 million new users during Facebook's outage.
Pavel Durov, CEO of Telegram, highlighted the app's growth surge during the outage.
Snapchat is ranked as the favorite social media app among teens, as per the Piper Sandler survey.
Despite Snapchat's popularity, Instagram remains the most used app by teens.
Telegram's new signups on the day of the outage amounted to about 10% of its total monthly active users.
Facebook's outage was caused by a 'faulty configuration change' to its backbone routers.
The last significant surge in Telegram users was in January, connected to issues with WhatsApp.
The outage affected Facebook's entire suite of apps, including Instagram, WhatsApp, Messenger, and Facebook itself.
